Name: House
Description: A standalone building designed for people to live in, usually with multiple rooms and amenities such as a kitchen and living room. Houses can range from small cottages to large mansions.

Name: Bed and Breakfast
Description: A lodging establishment that typically offers a room or suite for rent, often with breakfast included in the price. These establishments are usually small and independently owned, with a homey, intimate atmosphere.

Name: Bungalow
Description: A small, cozy house that typically has a low-pitched roof and wide front porch. Bungalows often have an open floor plan and are designed for single-level living.

Name: Guest Suite
Description: A self-contained unit within a larger accommodation, typically with a bedroom and private bathroom. Guest suites may also have additional amenities such as a kitchenette or living area.

Name: Hostel Accommodation
Description: A budget-friendly lodging option that typically offers dormitory-style rooms with shared bathrooms and communal areas. Hostels are popular among backpackers and budget travelers.

Name: Chalet
Description: A wooden house with a sloping roof and overhanging eaves, often found in mountainous areas. Chalets are popular among skiers and other outdoor enthusiasts.

Name: Loft
Description: A large, open space with high ceilings, typically located in a converted industrial or commercial building. Lofts often have an urban, modern feel and are popular among artists and young professionals.

Name: Villa
Description: A large, luxurious house typically located in a scenic or resort area. Villas often have multiple bedrooms, outdoor living spaces, and amenities such as a private pool or hot tub.

Name: Apartment
Description: A self-contained unit within a larger building, typically with one or more bedrooms, a living room, and a kitchen. Apartments are a popular housing option in urban areas.

Name: Serviced Apartment
Description: An apartment that comes with hotel-like services such as daily housekeeping and 24-hour reception. Serviced apartments are popular among long-stay travelers and business travelers.

Name: Hotel
Description: A lodging establishment that typically offers rooms or suites for rent, with amenities such as room service and on-site restaurants. Hotels can range from budget-friendly options to luxurious five-star properties.

Name: Boutique Hotel
Description: A small, stylish hotel with a unique design and personalized service. Boutique hotels are often independently owned and cater to travelers who want a more intimate, exclusive experience.

Name: Resort
Description: A large, full-service lodging establishment typically located in a scenic or recreational area. Resorts often offer a wide range of amenities and activities such as golf courses, spas, and water sports.

Name: Cabin
Description: A small, rustic dwelling typically made of wood or logs. Cabins are often located in scenic, remote areas and are popular among outdoor enthusiasts.

Name: Cottage
Description: A small, cozy house typically located in a rural or coastal area. Cottages often have a traditional, charming aesthetic and are popular among vacationers looking for a quiet, peaceful retreat.

Name: Guesthouse
Description: A small lodging establishment that typically offers a few rooms or suites for rent, often with shared common areas such as a kitchen or living room. Guesthouses are often family-owned and offer a more intimate, personalized experience.

Name: Townhouse
Description: A narrow, multi-level house typically located in an urban area. Townhouses are often attached to other houses in a row, and can range from small, simple units to large, luxurious properties.
